text: The current therapy against HCV infection , consisting of a combination of pegylated interferon ( IFN ) and ribavirin ( RBV ) , is limited by resistance , adverse effects , and high costs . The absence of preventive regiment is a major limitation for patients undergoing LT for HCV - related liver failure . Moreover , accelerated progression to liver cirrhosis after graft reinfection and limited efficacy of IFN - based therapies for recurrent HCV are two major clinical issues leading to poor posttransplant outcome of the HCV recipients [ 80 ] . Thus , novel preventive and therapeutic antivirals are urgently needed . Viral entry is required for initiation , spread , and maintenance of infection . HCV entry is a multistep process orchestrated by a number of viral and host cell factors .
